text: On 10 April 2016 at around 3:30 am Indian Standard Time, there was an explosion and fire at the Puttingal Temple in Paravur, Kollam, Kerala, India. The incident happened when firework celebrations went out of control. More than 100 people were killed. More than 350 were injured, some with severe burns. The temple did not have permission from Kerala Government authorities to do a competitive fireworks display. ==References== Category:2016 in India Category:2010s explosions in Asia Category:2016 fires Category:April 2016 events Category:Building and structure fires in Asia Category:2010s disasters in India Category:Explosions in 2016 Category:21st century in Kerala Category:2010s fires in Asia
